title.narrative: OOSC ACCESS TO EDUCATION

description.narrative: At least 50% of out-of-school vulnerable girls and boys in selected localities have access to formal and non-formal inclusive and equitable education opportunities, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: At least 3.8 million of the most vulnerable children (girls and boys) including children affected by humanitarian crisis have access and use scaled-up proven sustainable, high impact, integrated quality services for life saving, learning, development and protection in the most deprived localities in Sudan.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: At least 50% of out-of-school vulnerable girls and boys in selected localities have access to formal and non-formal inclusive andequitable education opportunities

description.narrative: Over 1.8 million previously out of school children from rural areas, nomads, IDP, emergency affected, refugees and children with disability have been supported by UNICEF and enabled to access education in formal and non-formal basic schools, representing a reduction in OOSC by 58 per cent from 3,097,328. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/03/2018

title.narrative: Number of children that received subsidies, scholarships, grants or social assistance from UNICEF to attend school, by gender
